long: Meaning: to "visit" (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to "oversee", "muster", "charge", "care for", "miss", "deposit", etc.  Usage: appoint, × at all, avenge, bestow, (appoint to have the, give a) charge, commit, count, deliver to keep, be empty, enjoin, go see, hurt, do judgment, lack, lay up, look, make, × by any means, miss, number, officer, (make) overseer, have (the) oversight, punish, reckon, (call to) remember(-brance), set (over), sum, × surely, visit, want.  Source: a primitive root;
